entry.string: If you want to provide your own presentation here, you can specify a different layout="..." to use in the default template, or you can specify your own template="..." here as well.
entry.translation: Iff yuoo vunt tu prufeede-a yuoor oovn presenteshun here-a, yuoo cun speceeffy a deefffferent leyuoot="..." tu use-a in zee deffoolt templete-a, oor yuoo cun speceeffy yuoor oovn templete-a="..." here-a es vell.

entry.string: This tag will retrieve the properties and values from DynamicData and make them available in the 'properties' and 'values' variables in your template.
entry.translation: Thees teg veell retreeefe-a zee pruperteees und felooes frum DynemeecDeta und meke-a zeem efeeeleble-a in zee 'pruperteees' und 'felooes' fereeebles in yuoor templete-a.

entry.string: You can then use those variables to build your own layout. The <xar:data-label ...> and <xar:data-output ...> tags allow you to show individual labels or value outputs in the template.
entry.translation: Yuoo cun zeen use-a thuse-a fereeebles tu booeeld yuoor oovn leyuoot. Um de hur de hur de hur. Zee <xar:data-label ...> und <xar:data-output ...> tegs elloo yuoo tu shoo indeefidooel lebels oor felooe-a ooootpoots in zee templete-a.

entry.string: APPROACH # 3 : getting the object list via API
entry.translation: EPPROECH # 3 : getteeng zee oobject leest feea EPI

entry.string: APPROACH # 4 : getting the raw item values via API
entry.translation: EPPROECH # 4 : getteeng zee rev item felooes feea EPI

entry.string: Here you'll have to handle the output format of the values yourself - in the module code and/or template...
entry.translation: Here-a yuoo'll hefe-a tu hundle-a zee ooootpoot furmet ooff zee felooes yuoorselff - in zee mudoole-a cude-a und/oor templete-a...
